tips.title: Camera Controls
tips.content: Use left mouse button to rotate, right mouse button to pan, and scroll wheel to zoom in and out of the 3D scene.

tips.title: Grid Snapping
tips.content: Enable grid snapping to align your objects perfectly. This helps create more precise models and maintains consistency.

tips.title: Save Often
tips.content: Remember to save your work frequently. Use Ctrl+S to quickly save your current project to avoid losing progress.

tips.title: Boolean Operations
tips.content: Use union to combine shapes, subtract to cut holes, and intersect to keep only overlapping parts. These are powerful tools for complex designs.

tips.title: Properties Panel
tips.content: The properties panel shows detailed information about your selected object. You can modify position, rotation, and scale values directly.

tips.title: Design for All Users
tips.content: When creating assistive technology, consider different abilities and needs. Test your designs with various user scenarios in mind.

tips.title: Ergonomic Considerations
tips.content: For grip-based tools, ensure handles are thick enough (2cm+) for users with arthritis. Smooth edges prevent injury and discomfort.

tips.title: Start Simple
tips.content: Begin with basic shapes and gradually add complexity. It's easier to combine simple shapes than to modify complex ones.

tips.title: Use Layers
tips.content: Organize your objects into layers for better management. This is especially helpful for complex assemblies.

tips.title: Test Your Designs
tips.content: Always consider how someone with limited mobility would use your design. Can it be operated with one hand? Is it stable?

tips.title: Material Selection
tips.content: Choose appropriate materials for your design context. Consider durability, safety, and manufacturing constraints.

tips.title: Keyboard Shortcuts
tips.content: Learn keyboard shortcuts to speed up your workflow: G (move), R (rotate), S (scale), V (select), Del (delete).
